stories.title: Trevor Noah’s feud with France over race, identity, and Africa

stories.text:
I speak French and English. I have localized my web app in these two languages. Now I'd like to add more languages.

I suppose that leveraging the two existing languages can help reduce ambiguity and improve the translation to a 3rd language?

Example: - the menu has "Home" as a first item, in English - in French, this item is translated as "Accueil" (literally, 'welcome' in English) => together, these point to a precise meaning of the item, that should be close to "Startseite" in German, not the German term for "Home" nor "Welcome".

Do you know of any translation service that would offer this feature?
stories.title: Ask HN: Better automated translation with 2 source languages?

stories.text: The #eurobsdcon 2022 CFP is open! We urge #BSD developers and competent practitioners to submit their work to present at the conference. Submissions open March 15 through May 26th. The conference is September 15-18, 2022 in Vienna, Austria. See https://2022.eurobsdcon.org/the-call-for-talk-and-presentation-proposals-for-eurobsdcon-2022-is-now-open/ for details. #openbsd #freebsd #netbsd
stories.title: EuroBSDCon 2022 Call for Participation is open
